metric_description: Test single record return with basic columns
sql: SELECT 'TEST_001' AS metric_id, 'Simple Single Record Test' AS metric_name, 'Count' AS metric_type, 'Test Description' AS metric_description, 'Daily' AS frequency, 100 AS numerator_value, 100 AS denominator_value, 100.00 AS metric_output, '2024-01-15' AS business_data_date

metric_description: Test SQL returning multiple records (10 rows)
sql: SELECT CONCAT('TEST_002_', CAST(row_num AS STRING)) AS metric_id, 'Multiple Records Test' AS metric_name, 'Count' AS metric_type, 'Test multiple records' AS metric_description, 'Daily' AS frequency, row_num * 10 AS numerator_value, row_num * 10 AS denominator_value, CAST(row_num * 10 AS FLOAT64) AS metric_output, '2024-01-15' AS business_data_date FROM UNNEST(GENERATE_ARRAY(1, 10)) AS row_num

SELECT 'TEST_003' AS metric_id, 'Currently Placeholder Test' AS metric_name, 'Count' AS metric_type, 'Test placeholder' AS metric_description, 'Daily' AS frequency, COUNT(*) AS numerator_value, COUNT(*) AS denominator_value, CAST(COUNT(*) AS FLOAT64) AS metric_output, '{currently}' AS business_data_date FROM `test_project.test_dataset.test_source_data` WHERE partition_dt = '{currently}'

SELECT 'TEST_004' AS metric_id, 'Partition Info Test' AS metric_name, 'Count' AS metric_type, 'Test partition info' AS metric_description, 'Daily' AS frequency, COUNT(*) AS numerator_value, COUNT(*) AS denominator_value, CAST(COUNT(*) AS FLOAT64) AS metric_output, partition_dt AS business_data_date FROM `test_project.test_dataset.test_source_data` WHERE partition_dt = (SELECT partition_dt FROM `test_project.test_dataset.test_source_data` WHERE partition_dt = {partition_info} LIMIT 1)

metric_description: Test all supported data types in results
sql: SELECT 'TEST_005' AS metric_id, 'All Data Types Test' AS metric_name, 'Mixed' AS metric_type, 'Test all types' AS metric_description, 'Daily' AS frequency, 100 AS numerator_value, 200 AS denominator_value, 50.5 AS metric_output, DATE('2024-01-15') AS business_data_date

metric_description: Test handling of NULL values in results
sql: SELECT 'TEST_006' AS metric_id, 'NULL Values Test' AS metric_name, 'Count' AS metric_type, NULL AS metric_description, 'Daily' AS frequency, NULL AS numerator_value, NULL AS denominator_value, 0.0 AS metric_output, '2024-01-15' AS business_data_date

metric_description: Test custom columns not in old METRICS_SCHEMA
sql: SELECT 'TEST_007' AS metric_id, 'Custom Columns Test' AS metric_name, 'Custom' AS metric_type, 'Test custom columns' AS metric_description, 'Daily' AS frequency, 'Region A' AS region, 'Department X' AS department, 'Category 1' AS category, 100 AS numerator_value, 200 AS denominator_value, 50.0 AS metric_output, '2024-01-15' AS business_data_date

SELECT CONCAT('TEST_008_', CAST(row_num AS STRING)) AS metric_id, 'Medium Volume Test' AS metric_name, 'Count' AS metric_type, 'Test 1000 records' AS metric_description, 'Daily' AS frequency, row_num AS numerator_value, row_num * 2 AS denominator_value, CAST(row_num AS FLOAT64) AS metric_output, '2024-01-15' AS business_data_date FROM UNNEST(GENERATE_ARRAY(1, 1000)) AS row_num

metric_description: First metric targeting same table for cache test
sql: SELECT 'TEST_009' AS metric_id, 'Same Table Cache Test 1' AS metric_name, 'Count' AS metric_type, 'Cache test 1' AS metric_description, 'Daily' AS frequency, 10 AS numerator_value, 10 AS denominator_value, 10.0 AS metric_output, '2024-01-15' AS business_data_date

metric_description: Second metric targeting same table for cache test
sql: SELECT 'TEST_010' AS metric_id, 'Same Table Cache Test 2' AS metric_name, 'Count' AS metric_type, 'Cache test 2' AS metric_description, 'Daily' AS frequency, 20 AS numerator_value, 20 AS denominator_value, 20.0 AS metric_output, '2024-01-15' AS business_data_date

SELECT 'TEST_011' AS metric_id, 'Different Table Test' AS metric_name, 'Count' AS metric_type, 'Different table' AS metric_description, 'Daily' AS frequency, 30 AS numerator_value, 30 AS denominator_value, 30.0 AS metric_output, '2024-01-15' AS business_data_date

metric_description: Test SQL with GROUP BY returning multiple records
sql: SELECT CONCAT('TEST_012_', region, '_', gender) AS metric_id, 'Group By Test' AS metric_name, 'Count' AS metric_type, 'Test GROUP BY' AS metric_description, 'Daily' AS frequency, region, gender, COUNT(*) AS numerator_value, COUNT(*) AS denominator_value, CAST(COUNT(*) AS FLOAT64) AS metric_output, '2024-01-15' AS business_data_date FROM `test_project.test_dataset.test_employee_data` WHERE partition_dt = '{currently}' GROUP BY region, gender

metric_description: Test SQL with Common Table Expressions
sql: WITH perm_count AS (SELECT COUNT(*) AS perm_total FROM `test_project.test_dataset.test_perm_employees` WHERE partition_dt = '{currently}'), non_perm_count AS (SELECT COUNT(*) AS non_perm_total FROM `test_project.test_dataset.test_non_perm_employees` WHERE partition_dt = '{currently}') SELECT 'TEST_013' AS metric_id, 'CTE Query Test' AS metric_name, 'Percentage' AS metric_type, 'Test CTE' AS metric_description, 'Daily' AS frequency, perm_total AS numerator_value, perm_total + non_perm_total AS denominator_value, ROUND(perm_total * 100.0 / (perm_total + non_perm_total), 2) AS metric_output, '{currently}' AS business_data_date FROM perm_count, non_perm_count

metric_description: Test decimal values with high precision
sql: SELECT 'TEST_014' AS metric_id, 'Decimal Precision Test' AS metric_name, 'Decimal' AS metric_type, 'Test decimal precision' AS metric_description, 'Daily' AS frequency, 123456789.123456789 AS numerator_value, 987654321.987654321 AS denominator_value, 12.345678912 AS metric_output, '2024-01-15' AS business_data_date

SELECT 'TEST_015' AS metric_id, 'Join Query Test' AS metric_name, 'Count' AS metric_type, 'Test JOIN' AS metric_description, 'Daily' AS frequency, COUNT(DISTINCT e.employee_id) AS numerator_value, COUNT(*) AS denominator_value, CAST(COUNT(DISTINCT e.employee_id) AS FLOAT64) AS metric_output, '{currently}' AS business_data_date FROM `test_project.test_dataset.test_employee_data` e INNER JOIN `test_project.test_dataset.test_department_data` d ON e.department_id = d.department_id WHERE e.partition_dt = '{currently}' AND d.partition_dt = '{currently}'
